locpix.img_processing.watershed.WatershedWidget#

class WatershedWidget(img, coords=[], file_name='Image')[source]#

Bases: QWidget

Widget to visualise an image as Grayscale 8 bit, then annotate with the seeds used for watershed. Child of QWidget. Left click places a seed, right click removes the seed. On closing the seed coordinates are saved

Parameters:

None –

scene#

This holds all the 2D items (img, all ellipses added)

Type:

QGraphicsScene

view#

Visualise the scene

Type:

QGraphicsView

pixmap_item#

Image representation that can be used as a paint device

Type:

QGraphicsPixmapItem

help_button#

Displays help for user

Type:

QPushButton

pen#

How the QPainter draws lines and outlines of shapes

Type:

QPen

brush#

How to fill the shapes drawn by the painter

Type:

QBrush

marker_coords#

List containing coordinates of the seeds for watershed

Type:

list

Constructor

Parameters:

  • img (int8 numpy array) – Numpy array range [0 255] which will be converted to correct format for pixmap

  • coords (list) – Seed coordinate list which will pass by reference

  • file_name (img name) – Will display the image name

__init__(img, coords=[], file_name='Image')[source]#

Constructor

Parameters:

  • img (int8 numpy array) – Numpy array range [0 255] which will be converted to correct format for pixmap

  • coords (list) – Seed coordinate list which will pass by reference

  • file_name (img name) – Will display the image name

closeEvent(event)[source]#

When closing the widget this function will be overloaded.

It will ask the user if they are sure, on closing the coords of the markers will be extracted

Parameters:

event (QEvent) – Event triggered by click

On mouse click this definition will be called

Left click: add seed Right click: remove seed

pyqtConfigure(...)#

Each keyword argument is either the name of a Qt property or a Qt signal. For properties the property is set to the given value which should be of an appropriate type. For signals the signal is connected to the given value which should be a callable.
